This compact commuting solution has been cascading down from its full $550 price tag since mid-way through January, with it reaching its lowest price to date here today. items.title: Burton Goods’ gorgeous leather Techfolio Cord Organizer just hit one of its best prices at 45% off
items.summary:
I am a big fan of the Burton Goods leather gear, from its iPhone 17 and MacBook cases through to its Apple Watch bands – anyone who reads 9to5Toys on a regular basis will know that. But one of its more recent releases I have been absolutely loving, using on a regular basis, and has found permanent spot in my tech setup is its Leather Techfolio Cord Organizer. This is a supremely sumptuous, elegant, and simply wonderful way to store your accessories whether you’re on the road or are just looking for a gorgeous place to keep small items on a shelf in your home. It’s not cheap, but you can land one at a giant 45% off right now using code BG20 at checkout.

items.title: Aventon just cut $900 off its Level 2 commuter e-bike for a new $999 low in a weekend flash sale
items.summary:
Aventon has launched a special flash sale that is dropping its popular legacy Level 2 Commuter e-bike to $999 shipped through the weekend only. While it’s been sporting an $1,899 MSRP for quite a while, we’ve more often seen it down at $1,599 or more recently keeping to $1,499 over the last year, with the latter being the lowest price we have tracked in its history. Now, however, Aventon is cutting a massive $900 off that tag price to land it lower than ever for only a few days, likely to make way for added stock of the new Level 3 smart e-bike and its step-through counterpart that have mostly kept to their $1,899 full prices. You can learn what to expect from this legacy model below, and be sure to jump on the deal while it lasts, as there is no telling if stocks will run out (and never be refilled) or if we will see another discount like this again.

more…

items.title: Revitalize lawns come spring with Worx’s budget-friendly 12A 14-inch corded dethatcher at $102 (Reg. $142)
items.summary:
Amazon is getting folks prepped for their spring lawn rejuvenation by offering the Worx 12A 14-inch Corded Lawn Dethatcher at $101.83 shipped. While it carries a $170 MSRP, it’s coming down from its more recent $142 rate that it’s been holding to in the new year, beating out all the prior discounts we’ve seen since July 2025. Considering that the Greenworks dethatcher/scarifier is only available in a $150 used condition, while Sun Joe’s model has been keeping to its full $160 price since mid-December, this is certainly the most affordable option for brand-new equipment that gives you budget-friendly functionality. All-in-all, you’re looking at a $40 markdown off the recent going rate (and $68 off the MSRP) for the best price we have tracked over the last six months and the third-best price overall.

If you missed out on that low price during Christmas/New Year sales, you’re getting it at the next-best rate here, as $151 is cut from the recent going rate (and $950 off the MSRP). You can also pick up Anker’s SOLIX C2000 Gen 2 power station by itself at $799 shipped (and matching at Amazon) if you don’t want the charge-as-you-drive functionality of the bundle, which we also recently went hands-on with in our latest review.
